Hunger strike in S. Korea
articles.content:
Hunger strike in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- All the unionists of the CBS of South Korea went on an indefinite hunger strike on June 18, Seoul-based MBC reported.
 The strike started according to the June 12 decision of the central committee of the trade union that all the unionists including those in the technical sector should go on strike. The trade union has waged the struggle for 9 months from last October in demand of the wage hike, system reform, etc.

Indian embassy officials help Korean farmers
articles.content:
Indian embassy officials help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Binanda Kumar Gogoi and officials of the Indian embassy here helped the farmers of the Korea-India Friendship Kalchon Cooperative Farm in Nampho on June 19 in weeding in a maize field.
 During a break they talked to each other, sang songs and danced, deepening the feelings of friendship.    
 The Indian guests handed aid materials to the farm.

Paek Nam Sun meets new Belgian ambassador
articles.content:
Paek Nam Sun meets new Belgian ambassador 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and conversed with Koenraad Rouvroy, new ambassador of Belgium to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.

articles.title: Credentials from new ambassador of  Belgium to DPRK
articles.content:
Credentials from new ambassador of  Belgium to DPRK
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Koenraad Rouvroy, new ambassador of Belgium to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of foreign affairs.    
 After receiving credentials, Kim Yong Nam conversed with the ambassador.
